a.title: Slice detail: The target value of the measure to be achieved to signify fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds or 7.0%, or in the case of pharmaceutical quality - NMT 0.6%, Clear solution, etc. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. When a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or above the low value.

a.title: Legend for this format

title.value: Cross-version Extension `R5.PlanDefinition.goal` for use in FHIR R4

description.value: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `PlanDefinition.goal` for use in FHIR R4.

purpose.value:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the element `PlanDefinition.goal` as defined in FHIR R5 in FHIR R4.
The source element is defined as: `PlanDefinition.goal` 0..* `BackboneElement`
Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as: * R5: `PlanDefinition.goal` 0..* `BackboneElement` * R4B: `PlanDefinition.goal` 0..* `BackboneElement` * R4: `PlanDefinition.goal` 0..* `BackboneElement`
Following are the generation technical comments: Element `PlanDefinition.goal` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `PlanDefinition.goal`, but has no comparisons.

short.value: What the plan is trying to accomplish

definition.value: A goal describes an expected outcome that activities within the plan are intended to achieve. For example, weight loss, restoring an activity of daily living, obtaining herd immunity via immunization, meeting a process improvement objective, meeting the acceptance criteria for a test as specified by a quality specification, etc.

short.value: The target value to be achieved

definition.value: The target value of the measure to be achieved to signify fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds or 7.0%, or in the case of pharmaceutical quality - NMT 0.6%, Clear solution, etc. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. When a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or above the low value.

comment.value: A CodeableConcept with just a text would be used instead of a string if the field was usually coded, or if the type associated with the goal.target.measure defines a coded value.

Note that the target element context `PlanDefinition.goal.target.detail[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `PlanDefinition.goal.target`. Element `PlanDefinition.goal.target.detail[x]` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `PlanDefinition.goal.target.detail[x]`, but has no comparisons. The context is moved up to parent element `PlanDefinition.goal.target`.
